title: Web Development in 2025
content: Modern web development relies on frameworks like React and Vue. Full-stack developers need to understand both frontend and backend technologies, including APIs, databases, and deployment pipelines for production applications.
author: Jane Smith

title: Data Science Best Practices
content: Data science teams should follow reproducible workflows, version their code and data, and document their experiments. This ensures that analyses can be replicated and extended by others in the organization.
author: Alice Johnson

title: Cybersecurity in 2025
content: Organizations must prioritize zero-trust architectures, regular penetration testing, and employee security training. Ransomware and phishing remain significant threats that require layered defenses.
author: Bob Wilson

title: Python > Other Languages?
content: Python remains popular for data science, automation, and web development. Its readability and ecosystem make it a strong choice for many projects, though the best tool always depends on the problem.
author: Carol Dev

title: Remote Work Culture
content: Remote and hybrid work require clear communication norms, async-friendly processes, and intentional team building. Companies that invest in these areas see better retention and productivity.
author: Diana Ross

title: DevOps & CI/CD
content: Continuous integration and continuous deployment reduce manual errors and speed up releases. Teams use tools like Jenkins, GitHub Actions, and GitLab CI to automate builds, tests, and deployments.
author: Eve Ops

title: Ethics in AI
content: Artificial intelligence raises important questions about fairness, transparency, and accountability. Policymakers and practitioners need to work together to ensure AI systems are designed and used responsibly.
author: Frank Ethics
